Package tinyboycov.core

Class TinyBoyInputGenerator

java.lang.Object
tinyboycov.core.TinyBoyInputGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
tinyboy.util.AutomatedTester.InputGenerator<tinyboy.core.TinyBoyInputSequence>
public class TinyBoyInputGenerator extends Object implements tinyboy.util.AutomatedTester.InputGenerator<tinyboy.core.TinyBoyInputSequence>
The TinyBoy Input Generator is responsible for generating and refining inputs to try and ensure that sufficient branch coverage is obtained.
Author:
David J. Pearce

  • Constructor Details

    • TinyBoyInputGenerator

      public TinyBoyInputGenerator()
      Create new input generator for the TinyBoy simulation. This method generates the pulses array input for the automatic test It generates an array of 500 pulses for 50 times It then shuffles the worklist array to make it even more random The pulse depends on a math random function to generate a random number which determine the input button

    • subsumedBy

      public static boolean subsumedBy(BitSet lhs, BitSet rhs)
      Check whether a given input sequence is completely subsumed by another.
      Parameters:
      lhs - The one which may be subsumed.
      rhs - The one which may be subsuming.
      Returns:
      True if lhs subsumed by rhs, false otherwise.
